'SM U-42' was a Pacinotti type submarine laid down on 18 August 1913 in Italy at
SocietÃ  Fiat-San Giorgio, Muggiano, La Spezia. Ordered by the Imperial German
Navy the submarine was confiscated by the Italian government on 8 August 1915
after entering war with the Austria-Hungary. Commissioned as 'Balilla' into the
Regia Marina the submarine was sunk off Lissa by Austro-Hungarian torpedo boats
65 T and 66 T.
